channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report E-2023070006
item.description:
Report E-2023070006

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 14, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of wire wheel cleaner was damaged by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted surface. ES personnel deployed neutralizer and absorbent pads to the released material. All spent absorbents were collected into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON THE UNLOAD TRAILER FROM THE PREVIOUS FACILITY. DescribePack: THE CAPS CAME LOOSE ON THE PLASTIC JUGS CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO SLOWLY LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON THE UNLOAD TRAILER FROM THE PREVIOUS FACILITY. DescribePack: THE CAP WAS LOOSE AND THE SEAL DEFECTIVE ON ONE OF THE PLASTIC JUGS CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. ANOTHER JUG HAD A DEFECTIVE THIN PART IN THE BODY THAT LOOKED LIKE IT WAS ABOUT TO CRACK OPEN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023061239
item.description:
Report X-2023061239

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: WHITE MARSH
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Out of the 6 1/2 gallon jugs, one had a loose cap, and some of the contents leaked out. As Far as I can see, it was the fault of the person who packaged the package, not making sure that all caps were properly secured. DescribePack: one cap was loose, causing a small amount of leaked, DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was retrieved and placed in a heavy duty HazMat bag, and placed in a black bin.

item.title: Report X-2023061177
item.description:
Report X-2023061177

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS PICKED UP ON LOAD SIDE WET AND LEAKING DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION FOUND 1 OUT OF 4 BOTTLES TO HAVE A BROKEN SEAL WHICH ALLOWED THE PRODUCT TO LEAK OUT. BAISED ON THE DAMAGE TO THE PACKAGE THE ORIENTATION ARROWS WERE NOT UTILIZED PROPERLY AND WHEN PACKAGE HANDLER JORDAN BROOKS 2957958 WENT TO LOAD THE PACKAGE IT SPILLED ON HIS KNEE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: RED TOTE
